intro: Bulliarda capensis, commonly known as the Cape bulliard, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the Aizoaceae family, commonly referred to as the ice plant family. The plant is characterized by its succulent, fleshy stems and leaves that are often covered in a fine, powdery coating. It produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring, attracting pollinators such as bees and butterflies. Bulliarda capensis is well adapted to arid environments and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
